GeneralInfos.Description: VO setup for grid collaboration of the Serbian scientific community.

The ALICE Collaboration is building a dedicated heavy-ion detector to exploit the unique physics potential of nucleus-nucleus interactions at LHC energies. Our aim is to study the physics of strongly interacting matter at extreme energy densities, where the formation of a new phase of matter, the quark-gluon plasma, is expected.

Resources.GeneralProcedures: ALICE requirements for the setting of sgm pool accounts on the VO-box and on WNs: 1. The sgm pool accounts should belong to the same group. 2. The shared software area $VO_ALICE_SW_DIR, the local VO-box directories $HOME and the services log directory (if not a sub-directory of $HOME) should be writable by this group.

GeneralInfos.Description: AMS02 is an experiment to search in space for dark matter, missing matter & antimatter on the international space station. The VO and in general the grid infrastructure will be used to provide access to data and computing resources to members of the collaboration, according to the AU Policy and Security Policy
VO setup for sites within AsiaPacific Region.
The aim of the ARGO-YBJ experiment is to study cosmic rays, mainly cosmic gamma-radiation, at an energy threshold of ~100 GeV, by means of the detection of small size air showers.
The "armgrid.grid.am" VOMS will be used for Armenian National Grid Infrastructure
This VO is intended to allow smaller astronomy and astrophysics experiments to collaborate using the EGEE infrastructure.

This VO is for accessing GRID resources associated with ASTRON. ASTRON supports radio astronomical scientists and operates the WSRT and LOFAR radio telescopes. Please note there is a separate VO for LOFAR related activities.
The goal of the VO is to enable the usage of Grid resources for users working on underwater neutrino telescope projects.

The ATLAS VO allow the members of the ATLAS collaboration to perform all the computing activities relevant for the ATLAS experiment, making use of the available resources following the policy defined by the Collaboration.

Resources.GeneralProcedures: - Job CPU limit is 2800 min / 8 HS06 or 5760 min / 1000 SI2k - Job Wall Clock Time limit is 3120 min / 8 HS06 - Preferably no limit on VMEM, otherwise choose the indicated value - Storage Setup: please refer to https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/Atlas/StorageSetUp

The BaBar detector was built at SLAC to study the millions of B mesons produced by the PEP-II storage ring. The BaBar Collaboration consists of approximately 600 physicists and engineers from 75 institutions in 10 countries.

Resources.GeneralProcedures:
A NFS server is mandate each site. Requirement for NFS is roughly specified below.
1. export to all WNs 2. more than 30GB 3. enable to be access by globus-job-run, because belle lib is installed by SGM remotly 4. write permission by SGM users
Resources.OtherRequirements:
We strongly offer to set kernel parameters as follows.
kernel.msgmnb = 65536 kernel.msgmni = 128 kernel.msgmax = 32768
In addition to set this, all WNs should mount single point on its vo software directory, referred by VO_BELLE_SW_DIR env vars, e.g. /opt/exp_soft/belle

The main purpose of this VO is computer science research to get more insight in the security of the widely used RSA public key cryptosystem. Complex, computing intensive General Field Number Sieving (GFNS) software applications are used for that purpose.
Sharing resources for computations in complex systems science.

The Global Monitoring for Environment and Security (GMES) concept was endorsed by the EU Commission in 2001 with the aim of ?establishing by 2008 a European capacity for Global Monitoring of Environment and Security? to gather and use all available data and information in support of sustainable development policies. GMES has the potential to stimulate economic growth by creating innovative value-added services. The challenge for GMES is to use these services to enable decision makers to better anticipate or mitigate crisis situations and management issues related to the environment and security. The Final Report for the GMES Initial Period recognised the European Civil Protection (CP) as one of the GMES service categories. This report outlines the importance to develop enabling e-infrastructures and virtual organisation services to serve specific GMES applications. Indeed, the EU EGEE (Enabling Grids for E-Science in Europe) project provides a powerful GRID platform to implement services for specific application Communities. However, GRID evolution has mainly focused on technology, while, GMES services have mostly been user-oriented. Thus, there is a need to cross-disseminating the approaches, requirements and visions of the diverse Communities, in order to fully exploit the GRID capabilities for GMES applications. CYCLOPS brings together these two important Communities: GMES and GRID, focusing on the operative sector and needs of European CP. The main objectives of CYCLOPS are:
1) To disseminate EGEE results to the CP Community, assessing EGEE infrastructure for CP applications.
2) To provide the EGEE Community with knowledge and requirements that characterise the CP services.
3) To evaluate the possibility to utilise the present EGEE services for CP applications, developing the research strategies to enhance EGEE platform.
4) To develop the research strategies to enhance EGEE platform, especially for Earth sciences resources.
CYCLOPS will contribute to the EU policy developments establishing liaisons and synergies with other existing projects and initiatives dealing with GMES, GRID and complementary sectors, among them: PREVIEW, Risk EOS, RISK-AWARE, BOSS4GMES, EGEE Networking Activities and Application Support, e-IRG and INSPIRE. In fact, Consortium partners are involved in all these projects and initiatives.

Resources.GeneralProcedures: VO_CYCLOPS_SW_DIR=$VO_SW_DIR/cyclops VO_CYCLOPS_DEFAULT_SE=prod-se-02.pd.infn.it VO_CYCLOPS_QUEUES="grid" VO_CYCLOPS_VOMS_SERVERS="vomss://voms2.cnaf.infn.it:8443/voms/cyclops?/cyclops" VO_CYCLOPS_VOMSES="cyclops voms2.cnaf.infn.it 15011 /C=IT/O=INFN/OU=Host/L=CNAF/CN=voms2.cnaf.infn.it cyclops"

It main objective is to coordinate European Data Centres in forming a co-operating community enhancing the European astronomical eInfrastructure and, thereby, maximising the scientific utilisation of the rich astronomical on-line resources distributed all over Europe.

EDGI develops middleware that consolidates the results achieved in the EDGeS project concerning the extension of Service Grids with Desktop Grids (DGs) in order to support the user communities of the European Grid Infrastructure (EGI) and National Grid Initiatives/Infrastructures. GeneralInfos.Description: DESY internal test VO.

This VO aspires to be the working environment for anyone involved in the creation of digital media objects, as well as processing and distribution thereof. Activities like scenes or film rendering, digital music composition, audio or video signal manipulation, signal stream handling and provisioning are explicitly allowed and in effect encouraged.
Rules: Membership to the VO is unrestricted. Breaching intellectual property rights is not allowed and any material carrying such risks is the responsibility of the submitting party exclusively. The VO reserves the right to allocate resources in the future for specific activities, implement ACLs or insert other resource fencing measures, in the interest of long-term sustainability, VO stability and endurance.

Resources.GeneralProcedures: Digital Content (audio/video) may arrive and be served by VO sites. Currently at experimental phase, no particular requirements. WNs better not be firewalled.

GroupAndRole.DESCRIPTION: eligible for accessing fast batch queues at the site.
for testing installation with multiple roles per VO member

Resources.GeneralProcedures:
The approval of a new user in the dteam VO as well as the assignment of roles and privileges within the VO are delegated by the VO Administrator to the VO representatives, who operate at regional level. The representatives and the group owners are allowed to create and then manage subgroups in cascade in order to better reflect the organisation at regional level.
Members of this VO are allowed to request any roles at any time within the scope of the group managed by the representative member they have selected, who has the full responsibility and authority to grant them. Applications to any roles outside this scope - although technically possible - will be rejected by the VO Administrator unless accompanied with a justification of the request provided by the representative. The rejection applies in particular to applications for the role 'lcgadmin' if requested in the scope of the root group /dteam
The reason for that is that the role lcgadmin is currently reserved for future use with the idea of using it for remote middleware installation at the sites.

IBERGRID VO for Engineering applications

Structural biology and life sciences in general, and NMR in particular, have always been associated with advanced computing. The current challenges in the post-genomic era call for virtual research platforms that provide the worldwide research community with both user-friendly tools, platforms for data analysis and exchange, and an underlying e-infrastructure. WeNMR groups different research teams into a worldwide virtual research community. It builds on the established eNMR e-Infrastructure and its steadily growing virtual organization, which is currently the second largest VO in the area of life sciences. WeNMR provides an e-Infrastructure platform and Science Gateway for structural biology towards EGI for the users of existing infrastructures. It involves researchers from around the world and will build bridges to other areas of structural biology. Integration with SAXS, a rapidly growing and highly complementary method, is directly included in WeNMR, but links will also be established to related initiatives. WeNMR will serve all relevant INSTRUCT communities in line with the ESFRI roadmap.

Resources.OtherRequirements:
The line: "/enmr.eu/*":::: has to be added to group.conf file before configuring via yaim the grid services. It is required to enable whatever VO group added for implementing per-application accounting.
Further, multiple queues should ideally be enabled with different Job Wall Clock Time limits:
- very short: 30 minutes max - for NAGIOS probes
- short : 120 minutes max - medium : 12 hours max - long : 48 hours

GeneralInfos.Description: Development, testing and production use of applications in the domains of environmental modeling and environmental protection described in the SEE-GRID-SCI project.

The Black Sea Catchment is internationally known as one of ecologically unsustainable development and inadequate resource management, which has led to severe environmental, social and economic problems. The EnviroGRIDS @ Black Sea Catchment project addresses these issues by bringing several emerging information technologies that are revolutionizing the way we are able to observe our planet. The Group on Earth Observation Systems of Systems (GEOSS) is building a data-driven view of our planet that feeds into models and scenarios to explore our past, present and future. EnviroGRIDS aims at building the capacity of scientist to assemble such a system in the Black Sea Catchment, the capacity of decision-makers to use it, and the capacity of the general public to understand the important environmental, social and economic issues at stake. EnviroGRIDS will particularly target the needs of the Black Sea Commission (BSC) and the International Commission for the Protection of the Danube River (ICPDR) in order to help bridging the gap between science and policy.

The main aim of VO Earth Observation Grid
resources association (computing, information and intellectual) of leading academic institutions for using highperformance and distributed computing in development of a system, dedicated for environment modelling with using Earth observation data
VO is working in several directions:
* active cooperation with Earth Science Research Cluster EGEE programme * active work in WGISS group of CEOS committee in Grid direction * numerous research projects

The Earth Science Research covers research in the fields of Solid Earth, Ocean, Atmosphere and their interfaces. A large variety of communities correspond to each domain, some of them covering several domains.
In the ESR Virtual Organization (ESR-VO) four domains are represented:
1. Earth Observation
2. Climate
3. Hydrology
4. Solid Earth Physics

GroupAndRole.DESCRIPTION: the VO software managers (usually mapped to local user account esrsgm)
protect source code for SpecFEM3D software

Resources.OtherRequirements: Many applications only need part of the following. Java/Perl/Python/C/C++/FORTRAN77,-90,-95; IDL and MATLAB runtime; Scilab or Octave. Needs MPI for some applications. Some applications require access to job output during execution, some even interaction via X11. 1 GB RAM; some applications need 3 GB RAM. Outbound connectivity from WN to databases. Shared file system needed for MPI applications, with about 10 GB of space. There are applications needing about 1000 simultaneously open files. Depending on application, output file sizes from some MB to 5 GB, for a total of several hundred thousand files. No permanent storage needed but transient and durable. Low-latency scheduling for short jobs needed.

GeneralInfos.Description:
ETICS stands for "eInfrastructure for Testing, Integration and Configuration of Software". It provides services to help software development projects to better manage complexity and improve the quality of their software. ETICS provides software professionals with an "out-of-the-box" build and test system, powered with a build and test product repository.
The eticsproject.eu VO is for users of the ETICS services deployed on the EGEE infrastructure.

GeneralInfos.Description: euchina Virtual Organization is designed to facilitate the development of new regional Grid application and communities, within the EUChinaGrid project.

EU-IndiaGrid will make available a common, interoperable Grid infrastructure to the European and Indian Scientific Community, in order to support existing EU-Indian collaborations in eScience and promoting new ones. In line with the support goals of the Research Infrastructures activity area of the European Union Sixth Framework Program, EU-IndiaGrid will hence enable the interconnection between the most relevant European Grid infrastructure, EGEE, and the Indian Grid. The partners of this project are prominent actors on the European and Indian e-Infrastructures scene:
* Italian National Institute for Nuclear Physics (INFN, project coordinator) * Metaware SpA * Consortium GARR - the Italian Academic and Research Network (GARR) * The Abdus Salam International Centre for Theoretical Physics (ICTP) * Cambridge University * The Indian Tata Institute for Fundamental Research (\"TIFR\", with an Institute in Mumbai and the National Centre for Biological Sciences, \"NCBS\", in Bangalore) * The Indian Education and Research Network (ERNET) * The University of Pune * The Saha Institute in Calcutta * The Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) * The Bhabha Atomic Research Centre
The major objectives of EU-IndiaGrid can be summarized as follows:
* To offer an effective answer to the demanding computing needs of several common EU-India research projects, supporting the interconnection and interoperability of EGEE with the Indian Grid infrastructure for the benefit of eScience applications; * To identify and aggregate actual and potential user communities for the newly implemented common infrastructure and promote its use through a specific outreach and dissemination program; * To develop synergies between scientific research and industrial communities, in order to foster the deployment of grid techniques in research and industrial applications within the Indian subcontinent.

Resources.GeneralProcedures: VO_EUINDIA_SW_DIR=$VO_SW_DIR/euindia VO_EUINDIA_DEFAULT_SE=prod-se-02.pd.infn.it VO_EUINDIA_QUEUES="grid" VO_EUINDIA_VOMS_SERVERS="vomss://voms2.cnaf.infn.it:8443/voms/euindia?/euindia" VO_EUINDIA_VOMSES="euindia voms2.cnaf.infn.it 15010 /C=IT/O=INFN/OU=Host/L=CNAF/CN=voms2.cnaf.infn.it euindia"

GeneralInfos.Description: Gaussian VO enables use of commercial chemical package Gaussian on EGEE Grid.

Geant4 is a toolkit for the simulation of the passage of particles through matter. Its areas of application include high energy, nuclear and accelerator physics, as well as studies in medical and space science. The two main reference papers for Geant4 are published in Nuclear Instruments and Methods in Physics Research A 506 (2003) 250-303, and IEEE Transactions on Nuclear Science 53 No. 1 (2006) 270-278.

Resources.OtherRequirements:
Per site, needs access to a shared file system with 5 GB space. Alternatively, access to a local SE with 5 GB space. This is for software installation only. In a transient fashion, up to 20 GB are needed up to the end of production, 0 GB afterwards.
IMPORTANT: high priority, low latency scheduling is needed during production runs (in june and december every year). Dedicated long running queues preferred.
Needs C++, Python, Perl.
More details in associated documents.
Already available for Geant4:
VOMS: group vomss://lcg-voms.cern.ch:8443/voms/geant4?/geant4 .geant
LFC: lfc-shared.cern.ch
RB: gdrb01.cern.ch, gdrb03.cern.ch

GeneralInfos.Description: The g-Eclipse project aims to build an integrated workbench framework to access the power of existing Grid infrastructures. The framework will be built on top of the reliable eco-system of the Eclipse community to enable a sustainable development. The framework will provide tools to customize Grid users' applications, to manage Grid resources and to support the development cycle of new Grid applications. Therefore, already existing tools (such as the Migrating Desktop, the GridBench suite, the Grid Visualisation Kernel (GVK), ...) will be integrated.

The g-Eclipse framework enables unexperienced user to access Grid infrastructures. The g-Eclipse team perfrom frequently training events at academic and commercial conferences. Therefore an agreement with the GILDA training infrastructure was made to get access to an EGEE like Grid infrastructure.
A fledgling VO for Irish bioinformaticians
Research Grid for high-energy physics Grid development in Germany.
GILDA is a training infrastructure open to any user willing to start their experience on grid computing, as well as beginner trying to port their applications on a production-like environment.

The Gamma-ray Large Area Space Telescope (GLAST) collaboration operates the GLAST satellite. The collaboration is international, composed of members of research institutions and universities of U.S.A, Italy, Germany, France, Sweden, and Japan. The satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral on June 11, 2008. On board of GLAST there are two scientific experiments. The Large Area Telescope will detect gamma-rays in the energy range from 20 MeV to 300 GeV, with very good position resolution (<10 arcmins), and an energy resolution in the range of 10%. Complementary, the GLAST Burst Monitor is sensitive in the range from 8 keV to 25 MeV. Together, they cover 25 octaves of the electromagnetic spectrum, with large angular acceptances.
High energy gamma-rays are tracers of the most extreme environments in the universe. Objects on the list to study are: gamma-ray bursts, active galactic nuclei, solar flares, and pulsars, pulsar wind nebulae, and supernova remnants. Moreover, GLAST could resolve the nature of dark matter, and is sensitive to effects proposed by theories extending the standard model of particle physics, like quantum-gravity.

Resources.GeneralProcedures: Sites must not use pool accounts for the sgm role. All VO sgm's must map to one single account. All roles/groups may have their own unix group. However, all users should be in the unix group of the standard user too. We request that not yet implemented (future) roles/groups are mapped to the standard user (i.e. MAP_WILDCARDS=yes for VO glast.org).
Resources.OtherRequirements: all: perl-DBD-MySQL scons (install with --enablerepo=dag) glibc-devel i686 (32bit) glibc-devel x86_64 (64bit) RHEL4/SL4: openmotif (libXm.so.3) compat-libstdc++-33 readline RHEL5/SL5: openmotif22 (libXm.so.3) compat-libstdc++-33 compat-readline43 (libreadline.so.4)

GeneralInfos.Description: The International Lattice DataGrid (ILDG) is a grid-of-grids infrastructure used for sharing data produced by numerical simulations of Quantum Chromodynamics formulated on a lattice (lattice QCD).

This project is focused to develop a novel computer-assisted instruction system for mammography images interpretation (CAISMI) supported by e-learning infrastructures, for training medicine students, medical personnel and people in general in the interpretation of mammograms and the diagnosis of breast cancer. In this context ?novel? means a valuable, validated and tested computer-aided instruction system for mammography interpretation. In practice the quest for novelty will be driven by e-learning experiments made with different levels of users over large scale digital mammography images repositories provided by GRID infrastructures.
VO for computational problems in Mathematics.

The National Institute for Astrophysics (INAF) is the central administration institute that promotes in Italy the research activities in Astrophysics through its network of 19 facilities (astronomical observatories and research institutes)

GeneralInfos.Description: The prime topics of our investigations include (but not limited to): research of the properties of quark-gluon plasma and high temperature Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD), models of color confinement, dynamics of topological objects in 3D and 4D systems, nonperturbative aspects of Yang-Mills theories and, in particular, of QCD, simulation of the QCD vacuum at zero and finite temperature with dynamical quarks. lattice approaches to the standard model and quantum gravity.
The LHCb (Large Hadron Collider Beauty) experiment is mainly set on finding the solution to the mistery of the matter-antimatter imbalance in the Universe.

GroupAndRole.DESCRIPTION: (Software Manager on EGEE. Static accounts are preferred)

This is the FQAN used when generic pilot will be allowed (gllexec ...). This role is only used to submit jobs UI/WMS/CE/WN. No needs to define access on SEs/LFCs/FTSes service. More exhaustive description of the usage of generic pilots is given a http://indico.cern.ch/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=20230
Production Managers. Static account are preferred
To be treated as any other default user presenting the FQAN /lhcb.

Resources.GeneralProcedures: VO Software is installed through specific tests within the SAM environment; the job checks for the architecture and platform running on the site and verifies the consistency of the software installed with the tags published. In case of need the SAM job installs (removes) the software missing/corrupted. The SAM suite runs under the "lcgadmin" VOMS role: /lhcb/Role=lcgadmin. The priority of the SAM jobs should be guaranted as high as possible in order to have these special jobs running immediately. The (pre)installation is done by downloading from central repository at CERN various packages (tarballs) that are unpacked and configured via CMT. Software shared area is required.
Resources.GlueSchemaFieldsUsed: GlueHostApplicationSoftwareRunTimeEnvironment GlueCEInfoHostName (for their mask system) GlueHostBenchmarkSI00 (for normalizing the queue lenght)
Resources.OtherRequirements:
LHCb strongly advice its T1's site to provide a reasonable number of slots per disk server that must be proportional to the maximum number of concurrent jobs the site can host. We do not want to give numbers here (that clearly depend on site specific parameters like hardware, protocols and size of the disk servers) but we want at least to warn sites that some default like 50 slots per disk-server must be risen up to 300. We further require at least a Memory SWAP of 1.5GB per job slot (reflecting the 750MB of memory per slot). For 64-bit platform the amount is 2GB of Virtual memory. The scratch space (set to 10GB in the field) must be interpreted as following: at T1 sites it must be about 15 GB ( = 5GB downloaded input files + 5GB produced file + buffer for locally installed software ). At non T1 sites a comfortable space is about 5 GB
The static gridmap-file should not contain any other mapping than .lhcb. It means that somehow the site must provide a edg-mkgridmap.conf file (used to build the /etc/grid-security/gridmap-file) that looks like that for LHCb:
# LHCB
# Map VO members (root Group) group vomss://voms.cern.ch:8443/voms/lhcb?/lhcb .lhcb
# LDAP lines for LHCB
w/o any reference to lcgadmin or production VOMS roles.
For SL4/SLC4 sites: it is sufficient the node has 32-bit compatibility. Recent investigation pointed out that in order to run a ROOT application the following system libraries for 32bit must be natively installed:
/lib/libcrypto.so.4 /lib/libssl.so.4 /usr/lib/libshift.so.2.1 /usr/lib/libshift.so /lib/libpcre.so.0 on dCache sites:
both 32 and 64 bit RPMs for dCache clients put the libraries under the same (undistinguished) path: /opt/d-cache/dcap/lib/libdcap.so
In order to run the latest version of ROOT, sites need to install the rpm ncurses on their worker node. Non-system libraries are shipped usually with the applications to guarantee such a compatibility.
Irrespectively the OS and capabilities of the site it is strongly required that the site does advertise correctly the platform accordingly the convention available at:
http://goc.grid.sinica.edu.tw/gocwiki/How_to_publish_my_machine_architecture http://goc.grid.sinica.edu.tw/gocwiki/How_to_publish_the_OS_name
It is also strongly required that sites keep separated clusters running different OSes (using different CEs).
ConditionDB (Oracle based) at T1: in order to allow (re)processing of data at all T1s and guaranteeing the access to the condition information from WN at T1 whenever the DB at the site is not available, all T1 sites should open the listener to the general WAN and not just to the OPN. Not all WN at T1 are indeed in the OPN.

GeneralInfos.Description: The VO libi intends to provide a grid environment and a set of services (tools, data) to the LIBI project bioinformatics community and deploy the project HT (High Throughput) applications.
IBERGRID VO for Life Science applications

The goal of the VO is to enable Photon Science (Synchrotrons and Free Electron Laser) communities to use the Grid, making these people be aware of the services provided by Grid infrastructures, allowing them to test and exploit them.
lofar is a vo associated with the lofar project.
The Netherlands based Lifescience VO
Magic a world leading Cherenkov Telescope for VHE Astronomy.

GeneralInfos.Description: Data mining of a strategic resource for Ireland: the National Seabed Survey
The Medgrid virtual organization was created for the support of medical research using resources of the Ukrainian national Grid.
Metereology VO of the SEE-GRID-SCI project.

The MINOS Experiment is a long-baseline neutrino experiment designed to observe the phenomena of neutrino oscillations, an effect which is related to neutrino mass. MINOS uses two detectors, one located at Fermilab, at the source of the neutrinos, and the other located 450 miles away, in northern Minnesota, at the Soudan Underground Mine State Park in Tower-Soudan.

MolDynGrid virtual laboratory was established in 2008 for interdisciplinary researches in computational structural biology and bioinformatics, which required a high processing power and immense storage space. In particular, this involves molecular dynamics simulations of biological macromolecules such as proteins, nucleic acids and their complexes. It is also important to compare MD simulations results with experimental NMR spectroscopy data on proteins dynamics. MolDynGrid virtual laboratory was established as a part of Ukrainian Academic Grid infrastructure. Laboratory?s main aim is to provide an efficient utilization of Grid infrastructure for automation of MD job processing. It will assist biologists in using Grid for their needs without requiring them to be familiar with highly complicated IT internals.

Goals
The na4.vo.eu-egee.org virtual organization brings together resources ? computing and human ? to help the NA4 activity provide better support to the EGEE user community. Specifically, people within this VO:
- help new users port their applications to the EGEE production infrastructure, - validate proposed solutions to problems facing users, - validate documentation/FAQs, and - write SAM tests to verify certain critical functionalities.
Those who are porting their software to the grid are expected to migrate to another VO after the porting and initial validation phases; these phases should not last more than 6 months. The resources within the VO are expected to cover the full range of grid functionality and use of them will help new users better understand what services must be supported within their own, new VOs.
Users
The goals require that two groups of people must have access to resources in this VO: 1. end users that are porting applications with the help of the NA4 Application Porting Support team and 2. support staff from the NA4 activity. The end users memberships will be for a maximum of 6 months. NA4 support staff may remain in the VO indefinitely.

Resources.GeneralProcedures: EGEE and the NA4 activity are in close collaboration with The MathWorks? in an effort to integrate the popular MATLAB? Parallel Computing Toolbox? with gLite. A first level of integration has already been achieved and currently a number of selected applications are exploring the capabilities of this solution. MATLAB Distributed Computing Server? is available from 2 production sites of this VO. The following support material is available for the users and grid site administrators currently exploiting the grid-enabled MATLAB toolbox on this VO: https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/EGEE/GLiteAndMATLABToolkitIntegration

lanck@EGEE is a project whose main goal is to use EGEE Grid Technology to process Planck Satellite data. The project is exploring scientific and technical problems that must be solved to develop GRID data reduction applications and make them available to the Planck community. The ESA Planck satellite mission will fly in 2007. This experiment is aimed to map the microwave sky performing at least two complete sky surveys with an un precedent combination of sky and frequency coverage, accuracy, stability and sensitivity.

Solar-Terrestrial Investigations and Archives

We are an international enterprise aiming at the construction of a very high luminosity asymmetric e+e- flavour factory. The physics studies possible at such a machine will provide a uniquely important source of information about the details of the new physics uncovered at hadron colliders in the coming decade. A heavy flavour factory such as SuperB will be a partner, together with the LHC and eventually the ILC, in ascertaining exactly what kind of new physics has been found.

lesstif-0.95.0-1.i386 lesstif-clients-0.95.0-1.i386 blas-3.0-25.1.i386 boost-1.32.0-6.rhel4.i386 lapack-3.0-25.1.i386 pcre-4.5-4.el4_6.6.i386

AGATA, the Advanced Gamma Tracking Array, is a future European high-resolution gamma-ray spectrometer for studies of the structure of exotic nuclei. The aim of the AGATA VO is to allow the members of the AGATA collaboration to perform GRID based storage and analysis of data produced by the AGATA spectrometer.

The ALEPH experiment was installed at LEP, the large electron-positron collider, at the CERN laboratory in Geneva/Switzerland. The use of grid is to allow data transfer from CERN to external sites. This VO will be supported by EGI-InSPIRE SA3 as part of TSA3.3 Services for HEP

The LEP experiment DELPHI would like to make use of the EGEE infrastructure to backup its real and simulated data files to institutes who accepts this data. The total amount of this data is of the order of 30TBytes, and the aim is to get at least one or two copies outside CERN which can be accessed with modern methods. The external copies will be used for disaster recovery. We are not planning to use any CPU resources.

The DORII project is supported by the European Commission within the 7th Framework Programme (FP7/2007-2013) under grant agreement no. RI-213110. DORII started in Feb 2008 and has a duration of 30 months. The project aims to deploy e-Infrastructure for new scientific communities, where on the one hand ICT technology is still not present at the appropriate level today, while on the other hand it is demanded to empower the communities? daily work.
The main focus of the DORII project is on groups of scientific users with experimental equipment and instrumentation that are currently not or only partially integrated in the European e-Infrastructures. At present, following selected scientific areas are represented in the project:
Earthquake community (with various sensor networks) Environmental science community Experimental science community (with synchrotron and free electron lasers)

The goal of this VO is to provide an e-Science environment to the Andalusia region. This VO will allow to share resources distributed around this region . Many different institutions and companies are integrated in this VO, that cover research, among other fields, in astrophysics, seismology, particle physics, fluid mechanics, economics, atmospheric physics, computer architecture, biology or information society technologies

Aim of DECIDE (Diagnostic Enhancement of Confidence by an International Distributed Environment) is to design, implement, and validate a GRID-based e-Infrastructure building upon neuGRID and relying on the Pan-European backbone GEANT and the NRENs.

PAU- Physics of the accelerating Universe: The main objective of this Consolider Ingenio 2010 is the preparation of a world-wide competitive experiment on a problem of great scientific interest and at the frontier of knowledge: the existence and nature of the dark energy of the Universe. The team includes scientists who work in related, yet different disciplines, namely particle physics, astrophysics and gravitation, both on theoretical and in phenomenological-experimental aspects, as well as engineers. Collectively, the members of the team are presently involved in important projects in this field, with collaborations that inter-relate the different groups. However, by asking for a Consolider Ingenio 2010 project, they want to take a step forward and assume a leadership role, intellectually and materially, in an experiment that represents a "qualitative jump" in their scientific contribution to the understanding of dark energy, a central problem in Cosmology at present. To this end the Consolider team proposes the construction of an instrument capable of obtaining the necessary measurements for competitive results on dark energy. This instrument consists of a very wide-field CCD camera (~ 6 deg2) for galaxy photometric red-shift measurements based on a large number of narrow-band filters. With this innovative technique, which only recently has started to be used, it will be possible to measure the red-shift parameter, z, with a precision of about 0.003(1+z) for early-type galaxies, close to that obtained with full spectroscopic methods, but in a much more efficient way, and sufficient for the scientific objectives being proposed. The construction of the camera will be by itself a major deliverable of the project. Its use in a survey of a 10,000 square degree area of the sky in the region for z between 0.1 and 0.9, which the team proposes to do, will provide data that will be among the most valuable that are expected to be available world-wide in the next few years for the study of dark energy. In addition to their involvement in the construction of the instrument, and in the simulation work required for its design and exploitation, the Consolider team will also study the dark energy problem from the theoretical point of view, with the interdisciplinary approach made possible by its composition. The team will also carry out educational and outreach activities towards society. And, as a team, it will study the joint participation on large-scale international dark-energy projects envisioned for the mid and long term future. see http://www.ice.csic.es/research/PAU/PAU-welcome.html for more details
local VO at PIC for testing the infrastructure
VO supporting national grid initiative in Poland -- PL-Grid

RENABI is the network of the french bioinformatics platforms, including in particular those from the 8 genopoles and other RIO (Inter-Organisms Research) platforms. The platforms provide the scientific community with many tools, databases and documents, either developped within the platform itself or widely used in bioinformatics. The goals of the VO is to gather the platforms of RENABI to fullfill the scientific objectives of distributing biological databases and analyzing these data with bioinformatics tools. These biological and bioinformatics resources will be used to solve the current scientific challenges in Life Science like for examples: analysing complete genome and metagenomes, modeling metabolic networks, understanding biological systems, modelling the structure and the behavior of biomolecules like proteins and DNA, determining function of proteins, identifying new drugs, understanding interactions like protein-protein, DNA-protein, ...
This VO provides general grid services and support for a wide range of scientific disciplines in Rhone Alpes region of France.
Local VO for local users from IPHC laboratory (IN2P3-IRES site).
The VO is for academic and other users in Scotland to test access to EGEE resources. Users will join this VO before deciding whether to setup one of their own for long term access.

Sim-e-Child is an FP7 EC funded STREP that is working to develop a grid-enabled platform for large scale simulations in pediatric cardiology, providing a collaborative environment for constructing and validating multi-scale and personalized models of a growing heart and vessels.

The goal of the VO is to do long-term tracking and collimation studies for the LHC and its pre-accelerators. The main tool is SixTrack, a simple tracking code fully debugged and optimized for speed. This FORTRAN77 code has been jointly developed with the IT specialist Eric McIntosh over the last 15 years. All LHC tracking studies including for collimation have been performed with this code. The Grid user community is exclusively the ABP group of CERN. Several tracking studies for the LHC and there pre-accelerators can presently not be performed due to the fact that our resources are insufficient.
The VO is for academic and other users in the SouthGrid region to test access to EGEE resources. Users will join this VO before deciding whether to setup one of their own for long term access.
Virtual Organization for testing and operations of the grid infrastructure deployed in the context of the StratusLab EU project (http://www.stratuslab.eu).

Direct Numerical Simulation of Navier-Stokes equations is the only way to fully describe any fluid flow. Our interest is in wall bounded flows like a turbulent channel or a boundary layer.
The comprehension of the fluid flow phenomena in such cases is an essential step to find a model that can describe wall-bounded turbulence, needed to solve important engineering problems.

The Virtual Organization u-psud.fr gathers EGEE users from the University Paris-Sud. The goal of this VO is to create a Campus Grid in the University. The VO provides an entry point for the university research teams and their external collaborators to the grid. Experience shows that geographical and organizational proximity are decisive for small groups or individual users in the first steps of the learning curve. The existence of the largest French EGEE nodes (GRIF/LAL site) inside the university is a major asset towards this goal. The VO introduces the grid technology into the students? experience, specifically through internships. The VO bootstraps new usages of the EGEE grid, beyond the well-established scientific communities.

VO intended for local users at Dakar university, where a grid site has been started recently (SN-UCAD). This VO is sort of a catch-all VO for local users (researchers, students) who cannot apply to another existing VO with the goal to encourage grid usage locally.
UPORTO local Virtual Organization

The EGEE project is organized on the regional principle. The Central Europe region is currently formed by Austria, Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Slovakia and Slovenia as defined in the EGEE Technical Annex. In order to have the opportunity to directly support researchers from this region, the Virtual Organisation for Central Europe (VOCE) computing service has been established.

Resources.GeneralProcedures:
All sites running their own WMS/LB instance are kindly asked to provide LB-based access by following:
a) Make sure that the LB initscript (by default, /opt/glite/etc/init.d/glite-lb-bkserverd) passes options "--super-users-file /etc/lb-superusers" and "--no-index=1" to the glite-lb-bkservd
b) Add the following DN to the file /etc/lb-superusers (it must fit to single line):
/DC=cz/DC=cesnet-ca/O=Institute of Physics of the Academy of Sciences of the CR/CN=lb-monitor.farm.particle.cz
Resources.OtherRequirements: Software installation requirements: - the full compiler suite should be installed in the WNs

GeneralInfos.Description: Hiding the Grid: WebCom-G is a new non-von-Neumann execution architecture for the grid.
The objective of the XFEL.EU Virtual Organization is to support the computing activities of the European X-Ray Laser Project XFEL by enabling access to the EGEE Grid infrastructure.

The objective of the XRAY Virtual Organization is to study the feasibility to participate in the EGEE Grid initiative as a complementary data management tool (storage and analysis) for data intensive Synchrotron Radiation research. Grid infrastructure could help handling the enormous data output of certain experiments carried out at Synchrotron facilities. The implementation of a Grid environment and the porting of scientific software to such an environment is the main goal of this project.
VO for the ZEUS experiment at HERA
